parameters: \pop[2]A second screwdriver sits in front of me, as Kyron looks at us with a smirk.
\pop[2]It seems like we'd be playing a questions game again, but with some colony flair.
\pop[2]Makes perfect sense, of course. Taking in a \c[10]zero\c[0] meant learning about their culture.
\pop[2]But it seems like, technology aside, their culture wasn't too different from our own.
\pop[2]So no matter what was about to come my way, I think I'd be prepared.
I'll explain the rules, and take the first turn.
\pop[3]When it's your turn, you make a statement.
"Raise your hand if", and then finish the sentence.
If the statement applies to you, you raise your hand.
\pop[3]There's a bit more to it than that, though.
You get to ask a follow-up question afterward.
Like, why someone raised their hand, or even why they didn't.
\pop[3]Great. Can't wait to be put on the spot again.
\pop[4]This could actually be a bit more entertaining.
No cards to play by, so we can go for the throat by default.
\pop[4]Well, I think Kyron's stepping up to bat.
How about we let \c[14]him\c[0] set the tone for all this?
\pop[3]I'm planning to keep it pretty simple, actually.
At least at first, so I know you're telling the truth.
I just thought it'd make things more fun.
Or if we refuse to answer the follow-up question.
\pop[4]I'm down for that. I'll just be sipping, though.
Gotta take it easy after the nightclub last week.
\pop[3]\c[14]And\c[0] to prepare for The Quantum Leap.
New Year's Eve is always a big day for booze.
\pop[3]Good thing I helped you carry all those bottles home, huh?
\pop[3]Couldn't have done it without you, man.
\pop[2]He holds his glass up before taking a sip, like he's saying "cheers".
\pop[2]We all do the same, and then look over at Kyron.
\pop[2]It was time for the game to begin...
You think your visions are set in stone.
\pop[2]This one is pretty easy for me, since I've never had a vision.
\pop[2]But almost everything I know, tells me that they aren't set in stone.
\pop[2]This is mirrored by the fact that nobody raises their hand.
\pop[2]I guess he wasn't lying when he said he'd start with a simple one.
\pop[2]But even lie detector tests start with some easy questions to "ground" you.
\pop[2]I think it was for peace of mind, so he knows we're taking things seriously.
\pop[2]He smirks, like the test was effective.
I could tell you don't like being told what to do.
Whether it's \c[23]Argus\c[0], or even your own future.
\pop[3]Yep. We even made a pact to defy our visions.
Didn't like the fact that we weren't a part of each other's.
\pop[3]Yep! Well, except for Delta, of course.
\pop[2]Kyron looks at me, a little confused.
\pop[2]This is when I tell him that I haven't had a vision.
\pop[2]He laughs nervously, and rubs the back of his head.
\pop[3]Well, I'm not sure how to take that.
So either my condolences, or congratulations.
\pop[2]I shrug. It doesn't really bother me, being the odd one out.
\pop[2]But it makes me feel very left out when topics like this come up.
\pop[3]I think I'm gonna choose Klace for my follow-up.
\pop[3]Yeah. Why don't you think our visions are real?
Surely you're still a popstar in your own?
\pop[4]Well, it was still my choice to pursue this life.
It's not like anyone held a gun to my head and told me to sing.
It seemed a lot less risky than my other options.
But at the end of the day, I still \c[14]had\c[0] those other options.
\pop[4]So it was more like a blueprint that I chose to follow.
Or maybe it was like following in someone else's footprints.
I still have the power to turn around and forge my own path.
\pop[2]That's fair, and we all agree with a single nod.
\pop[4]I have a pretty good one, actually.
\pop[2]A smirk appears on Dante's face that I can only describe as evil.
You've slept with somebody at this table.
\pop[2]But to my surprise, Isaac, Taylor, and Klace all raise theirs.
\pop[2]All eyes are on Klace, despite the fact that multiple hands are raised.
\pop[4]Hey! Isaac and Taylor raised their hand, too.
You've been here for like... a week.
\pop[2]He takes a big sip of his drink. An advance refusal to answer any follow-ups.
\pop[2]The entire table bursts into laughter. Obviously, except for Klace.
\pop[2]I feel bad for him. All he did was be honest with the group.
\pop[2]Isaac smiles, and preemptively raises his hand.
You think we're doing the right thing.
\pop[2]A moment later, everyone raises their hand.
I mean, I'm pretty sure we're all in this together.
\pop[4]Whether we like it or not, I might add...
\pop[3]Yeah, but we're doing the right thing for sure.
This time, the right thing just happens to go against \c[23]Argus\c[0].
\pop[4]Right. Well, I guess it's time for my follow-up.
\pop[2]He looks directly at me, and points his finger in a dramatic fashion.
\pop[4]Why do \c[14]you\c[0] think we're doing the right thing, Delta?
It was a tie between you and Kyron, but he's kind of biased.
\i[3]"Society has to move forward, even if it goes against the status quo."
\i[3]"Unity is important. We should celebrate our differences, not punish them."
\i[3]\c[23]Argus\c[0] is too old-fashioned. If they don't adapt, they'll just become obsolete."
\i[3]"I think everybody deserves a chance to start fresh. Just like me.
\i[3]"It just feels right. Like, this is what we're \c[14]supposed\c[0] to be doing."

\i[3]"Unity is important. We should celebrate our differences, not punish them."
\i[3]\c[23]Argus\c[0] is too old-fashioned. If they don't adapt, they'll just become obsolete."
\i[3]"I think everybody deserves a chance to start fresh. Just like me.
\i[3]"It just feels right. Like, this is what we're \c[14]supposed\c[0] to be doing."
\pop[2]Everyone nods and smiles at my answer.
I actually dig this game, Kyron. Good idea.
Gotta repay you somehow, after all.
\pop[2]A moment later, Klace slaps his hand down on the table.
You think I should sing karaoke.
\pop[2]A curious question, and nobody raises their hand.
\pop[2]He was probably checking if any of us thought we were under suspicion.
\pop[2]What a clever way of checking in with the group while remaining under the radar.
\pop[4]Well, then I have a follow-up for Kyron.
How'd it go when you ordered the screwdrivers?
Scanned my phone, heard a beep, and I was good to go.
Could've used a hand with the tray, but I understand.
\pop[3]I was a little scared, to be honest.
But you definitely know what you're doing.
\pop[4]I don't know if that's a good idea.
\pop[3]I don't know him that well, and even \c[14]I\c[0] agree.
I have a good question, I promise.
\pop[2]A silence ensues, as if it's a challenge for him to prove his words.
You're jealous of somebody at this table.
We're built to want the stuff that other people have.
But now I gotta figure out who to put on the spot.
\pop[2]We all seem fine with answering, so there's no "easy target".
My curiosity is getting the better of me.
\pop[3]To be fair, you didn't answer last time.
So I think this is better. Less embarrassing, too.
\pop[4]But honestly, my answer is all of you.
I'm jealous of \c[14]everybody\c[0] at this table.
This whole idol thing can really take its toll.
It's like - living for somebody else, instead of yourself.
\pop[4]When my hiatus is over, I have to get back to work.
But all of you get to keep on living this awesome life.
They'd never let me walk the streets, or go to a tavern.
\pop[3]Looks like we have more in common than I thought.
\pop[3]I mean, neither of us are fully in control of our lives.
We're governed by circumstances outside of our control.
With me, it's \c[23]The System\c[0], and with you, it's the industry.
\pop[4]I'm honestly surprised they let him take a break.
Time is money, and now they're losing plenty.
Got a lot of song ideas floating around in my head, too.
If anything, this hiatus is just a big rush of inspiration.
\pop[4]I could go for one of those.
\pop[2]They hit their cups together, and a small ring echoes.
\pop[2]That's true. Everyone else has already went.
\pop[2]But I'm not sure what my prompt should be...
\pop[3]I'll call the stalling rule if I have to.
\i[3]"Raise your hand if you think I've been a positive addition to the group."

\i[3]"Raise your hand if you're keeping a secret from the group."

\pop[2]But out of curiosity, I ask Dante for some elaboration.
\pop[4]Heh. Well, you've definitely made things more interesting.
Living alone with Isaac was starting to get a little stale.
No offense, of course. It's just good to switch things up.
Besides, I told Delta the same thing.
We're all a bit inspired after last week.
\pop[4]And just for the record, I feel the same way about Klace and Kyron.
I could tell they were asking the same question in their heads.
This group is not only bigger, but \c[14]better\c[0] than ever before.
\pop[2]Everyone smiles, even though Isaac kinda hijacked the conversation.
\pop[2]I'm satisfied with my turn, so I nod, signaling that it's time to move on.
\i[3]"Raise your hand if you'd go out on a date with me."
\pop[2]Even Kyron. I don't know why, but that kind of surprised me.
\pop[2]A few blushes are worn, including one on my own face.
\pop[4]I'm only raising my hand because we \c[14]are\c[0] dating.
Not sure if everyone else knew, but yeah.
\pop[4]I'm only raising my hand because of how obvious it is.
But it's good to know that I'm not the odd one out, here.
Wouldn't complain if we got to know each other better.
In fact, it might even put me on the same page as everyone else.
Not surprised in the least, though.
\pop[3]I mean, I tried making a pass, but I got denied.
Doesn't bother me, though. We're still good friends.
\pop[4]I actually asked Delta to be my date for The Quantum Leap.
Well, at least one of the midnights, since we have four.
\pop[2]Interesting to leave out the fact that I said we'd just go as friends...
\pop[4]What a tangled web you all weave...
\pop[4]I'm not gonna sit here and deny it.
\pop[2]Wow. Didn't expect \c[14]everybody\c[0] to follow-up on their own.
\pop[2]But I guess I'm flattered, and at least everything is out in the open.
\pop[2]It might be actually a good idea to bond with Kyron when I get the chance.
\i[3]"Raise your hand if you're keeping a secret from the group."
\pop[2]Everyone immediately raises their hand. Except for me.
\pop[2]I gotta say, that's not what I was expecting.
\pop[3]Too bad we can't make them elaborate on their own question.
It's only natural to have them.
\pop[3]True. I guess a secret isn't malicious by default.
Anyway, raise it up, Delta. We know you're lying.
\pop[2]I decide to direct my follow-up question toward Isaac.
\pop[2]He seemed so open about everything, I had no clue what his secret could be.
\pop[2]But a moment later, an uneasy silence takes over the table. Bad call, I guess?
We don't want to know your secrets.
How about we all take a drink?
You know, to valuing each other's privacy.
